result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucio Blanco was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft -Intentionally Take (<=$500) AMENDED FROM Retail Theft-Intention. Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
No contact with Pick 'n Save except for restitution purposes.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.

Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 7, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Lucio Blanco in court with attorney Paul Hammes.  Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Offer has been made.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 7, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:    No contact with victim stores except for restitution purposes.   No contact with the co-defendant.It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Lucio Blanco in court with attorney Michelle M Anderson.  Defendant Lucio Blanco in custody.  Sharon A Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
